intro: Argythamnia cubensis, commonly known as the Cuban thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly Cuba. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features spiny stems and leaves, with yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in dry, open habitats and is often found in coastal areas. Argythamnia cubensis is also noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
